Exaggerate: The claim of "violating federal election law 19 times" is an exaggeration, as there was only one violation cited by the Federal Election Commission.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in the provided claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on overreaching by opposition researchers and misinterpretation of FEC notices.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the 18 additional notices from the FEC indicate violations, when in fact they were routine requests for additional information.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide any alternative explanations.
